94399.name: Adrift (2011)
94399.description:
Adrift is a sci-fi game that (in theory) requires no vision at all to learn and to play.

From the Author:

"Your spacecraft has just been destroyed. Perhaps you were attacked. Perhaps something malfunctioned. Perhaps a rogue bit of space debris struck a vital component. Either way, it all went wrong, and all that remains of your mission is this escape pod and the crew members who managed to climb aboard. In the chaos, even your pod took some damage. Lighting has been shut down to save power for more necessary systems.

You and a handful of survivors, huddled in the dark, trying to make your way home through the most dangerous patch of space in this sector. Can you work together to make it home safely? Or will you spend the rest of eternity floating aimlessly in space, adrift?

Adrift is a prepless, GMless RPG that can be played in two hours or less and exists in an audio/tactile format, meaning the rules and materials are audio files, and the randomizers rely on the sense of touch. It is meant to be played in as dark a room as possible."

94400.name: Solitaire (Mobilityware)
94400.description:
User Summary

This is a version of the solitaire card game Klondike for iOS. It features several game modes and scoring methods, statistics tracking, Game Center support (including achievements), and a competitive multiplayer mode in which two players compete for a high score using identical decks.

94401.name: FallDown!
94401.description:
FallDown! is a simple but fast-paced and addictive game. Just tilt your device to control the ball. Fall down through the holes and avoid getting squished at the top. Score points by staying alive as long as possible.

Source: The Developer Website.

94402.name: BOOM BLOX (mobile)
94402.description:
Crash through blocks and bombs to level the playing field in this action-packed puzzle game.

Features

40 engaging physics based puzzles
Wide range of challenge difficulty
Easy, intuitive puzzle editor
Play and rank Online custom puzzles

Source: The Developer Website.

94403.name: StepMania
94403.description:
StepMania is an open source and cross-platform rhythm video game and engine. It was originally developed as a simulator of Konami's popular arcade game series Dance Dance Revolution, and has since evolved into an extensible rhythm game engine capable of supporting a wide variety of rhythm-based game types. Released under the MIT License, StepMania is free software.

The primary game type features the following game play: as arrows scroll upwards on the screen, they meet a normally stationary set of target arrows. When they do, the player presses the corresponding arrows on his or her keyboard or dance mat. The moving arrows meet the targets based on the beat of the song. Stepmania strongly utilizes a player's sense of rhythm in its game play. The game is scored based upon how accurately the player can trigger the arrows in time to the beat of the song. The player's efforts are awarded by letter grades and a number score that tell him/her how well they have done. An award of AAAA (quadruple A) is the highest possible award available on a standard installation and indicates that a player has triggered all arrows with "marvelous" timing (within 0.0225 seconds under official settings) and avoided all mines and completed all hold arrows. However, a patch is available that provides "ridiculous" timing (within a window of 0.01125 seconds, or half the timing of marvelous) and a top grade of AAAAA (quintuple A). An E indicates failure for a player to survive the length of the song without completely draining his/her life bar. Default scoring and grading for Stepmania is almost identical to scoring in Dance Dance Revolution; however, timing and scoring settings can easily be changed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Stepmania", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94404.name: M.U.G.E.N.
94404.description:
M.U.G.E.N (also known simply as MUGEN) is a freeware 2D fighting game engine designed by Elecbyte, written in C which originally used the Allegro library. The latest versions of the engine now use the SDL library.

The engine uses 7 buttons for gameplay along with the directional keys, in order to accommodate six-button fighters, which use three punches, three kicks, and a start button. However, characters do not necessarily use all seven buttons, nor need to follow a traditional six- or four-button format. At most, two human players can control characters, with others controlled by the engine's AI; including a demo mode where the computer controls all characters. In addition, several gameplay modes are available via the main menu.

Source: Wikipedia, "M.U.G.E.N", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94405.name: Beyond Atlantis II
94405.description:
Atlantis III: The New World (Known as Beyond Atlantis II in USA) is a fantasy adventure computer game developed by Cryo Interactive and published by Dreamcatcher Interactive, and released in 2001. It's the third in the Atlantis series by Cryo, as well as the last one made before Cryo's downfall. Similar to the second game, not much of the game is based around Atlantis. It was followed by Atlantis Evolution in 2004.

Source: Wikipedia, "Atlantis III: The New World", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94406.name: Glover
94406.description:
User Summary

Glover is a 3D platform game. You play as an anthropomorphic glove named Glover, and your goal is to return six magic crystals to a wizard's castle. You have to guide the crystals through various levels, and as you do so you can transform the crystals into several different types of balls, including a bowling ball, a metal ball bearing, and a bouncy rubber ball. Many of the game's puzzle revolve around the different properties of the different types of balls.

94407.name: Dragon's Lair 3D: Return to the Lair
94407.description:
Dragon's Lair 3D: Return to the Lair is an action-adventure video game released in 2002 by Dragonstone Software. The game is based on Cinematronics' 1983 laserdisc arcade game Dragon's Lair, and follows a similar story; the hero, Dirk the Daring, must enter the evil wizard Mordroc's castle to rescue Princess Daphne from a dragon. Many of the characters and locations from the 1983 original make appearances in the game, along with new puzzles, rooms and enemies. Animator and director Don Bluth, who produced the cartoon animation for the arcade original, also produced two new animated sequences for the opening and ending of the game. The game uses cel shading to mimic the distinctive style of the original.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dragon\'s Lair 3D", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94408.name: SNES Controller
94408.description:
User Summary

The standard SNES controller has four buttons play buttons (X, Y, A, & B) on the front right of the controller. It has two shoulder buttons (R & L) on the top edge. It has a directional pad on the front left side of the controller. In the middle there are Start and Select buttons.

Official Versions:

North America

SNS-005
This the original controller for North America. The buttons are purple and lavender colored. The SNES logo for was silk screened on to the controller.

SNS-102
This is the controller that was released with SNES 2. The main changes from the SNS-005 controller was it was a little sturdier and the SNES logo was molded in the plastic. Also, the buttons are a little darker shade of purple.

Japan

SHVC-005
This the original Super Famicom controller that was released with the launch of Super Famicom. The main difference from the North American SNES controller is the buttons are green, blue, yellow, and red.

SNS-102
This controller is identical to the North American SNS-102 buttons are green, blue, yellow, and red. It also uses the Super Famicom branding.

Europe

SNSP-005
This is the original controller for the SNES European version. It has the same color layout as the official Super Famicom controller with red, blue, green, and yellow buttons. It uses the Super Nintendo branding instead of Super Famicom branding.

SNS-102
This is controller is identical to the Japanese SNS-102 except it uses the Super Nintendo branding.

Un-Official Controllers

There are many clone controllers that have been released by different manufactures including Yobo. Most people consider these controllers to be inferior to the official Nintendo controllers.

94409.name: Bomberman
94409.description:
User Summary

Bomberman makes its way to Nintendo DS, featuring Wireless DS, Single-Card, Download Play, which allows up to 8 bombermen to duke it out DS to DS to DS to.... Additionally, players have the option of using their voice to detonate bombs and taunt their opponents. As had come to be the tradition for the Bomberman franchise, this DS game also packs a long single-player mode, in this case including 100 stages. So, although Bomberman has evolved quite a bit, because the gameplay hearkened back to a style closer to the original, Hudson Soft decided to reuse the original name.

94410.name: Brain Voyage
94410.description:
User Summary

Reiner Knizia provides a series of 80 puzzles with all sorts of random themes, and a 3D model of the man himself is the MC for your gaming experience. Brain Voyage supports Single-Card Download Play, as well.

94411.name: Expedition Europe, Asia & Oceania
94411.description:
This card game is designed to help players learn facts about the features, history, people, countries, and capitals in Europe, Asia, and Oceania. The game includes 100 cards divided into 5 separate subdecks: Western Europe, Russia and Eastern Europe, Middle East, Far East, and South Pacific and Australia.

Each round of the game is played with one subdeck. Each card features a question, the answer to the matching card, a map of the country, and an illustration accompanying a fact about that country. Players take turns asking each other for cards that answer questions on the cards in their hand. When they ask for a card with an answer that correct answers their question, the pictures on the two cards will match. The object of the game is to have the most card matches when play is over.

94412.name: 3D Maze Man
94412.description:
3D Maze Man is a 1998 computer game.
Conceptually, it is influenced by Namco's popular arcade classic Pac-Man in that the main character (Maze Man) is a yellow sphere with a triangular mouth whose goal is to collect all the pellets in the current level and avoid the enemy ghosts. Like in Pac-Man, there are pellets which allow Maze Man to, for a short period of time ("Party Time"), eat the enemy ghosts, who regenerate from a specified location. Aesthetically, however, the 3D format of the game allows for a number of other features which differentiate it from Pac-Man. It provides for the ability to jump (also seen in Pac-Mania), enabling 3D Maze Man to avoid the ghosts when not in "Party Time". Also, the navigable platforms can span multiple altitudes, allowing for sloped or "elevator" platforms. In addition, some levels include colored keys which unlock certain correspondingly colored bricks, green spaces which prevent Maze Man from jumping, and red spaces which kill Maze Man on impact.

Source: Wikipedia, "3D Maze Man: Amazing Adventures", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94413.name: 3D Maze Man: Adventures in Winter Wonderland
94413.description:
User Summary

3D Maze Man: Adventures in Winter Wonderland is a variant of 3D Maze Man with winter-themed graphics. Like in 3D Maze Man, you play as a yellow sphere exploring a maze, collecting candy and avoiding enemies. In this variant, 3D Maze Man wears a Santa hat, the candies are candy-cane style peppermints, and there are very Christmas-themed decorations around the mazes.

94414.name: 3D Table Sports
94414.description:
User Summary

3D Table Sports is a collection of three mini-games: foosball, air hockey and "power hoops", a basketball-type game played on a simulated toy table. All three of these games can be played against artificial intelligence or against a human opponent. Up to 16 players can compete in tournaments over a network.

94415.name: PBA Tour Bowling 2
94415.description:
User Summary

PBA Tour Bowling 2 is a 3D bowling game for Windows developed by Bethesda Softworks. It is officially licensed by the Professional Bowlers Association.

94416.name: Harley-Davidson Monopoly: Collector's Edition
94416.description:
Incorporating the classic strategy of the Monopoly game with the Harley-Davidson® legacy of open-road freedom. With a full complement of individually sculptured gaming pieces, each lavishly coated in sterling silver. Combining legendary Monopoly game graphics with illustrations that celebrate the history of Harley-Davidson® motorcycles, the handsome hardwood-framed playing board is accentuated with corners that are enhanced with silver-toned die-cast bolsters. To house all your components, a custom-designed banker's drawer is fitted into the playing board.

Best of all, the lush green playing surface is luxuriously framed in fine hardwood, to present the classic MONOPOLY game graphics as never before.

Featuring a full complement of gaming pieces, with hotels accented in 24 karat gold and houses accented in sterling silver.
Complete with hardwood-framed playing board, specially designed "Chance" and "Community Chest" cards and Harley-Davidson® "money."

Authorized by Harley-Davidson® and Hasbro.

94417.name: Yaleopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
94417.description:
This is a Monopoly variation featuring Yale campus and area businesses.

From the box: Buy campus properties and favorite area businesses as you make your way around the board. Collect credit hours and trade them for diplomas. Academic Probation sends you home...or make the Dean's list and collect a $200 scholarship.

94418.name: Disney Golf
94418.description:
This game features eight characters to play as or against on a choice of six different courses. Players will be able to select from Donald, Goofy, Minnie, and little Morty to start, with Daisy, Pete, Professor Von Drake, and Max waiting in the wings. Characters are grouped into one of four types: Normal, Power, Technique, and Kids, with the last offering a simplified control system for younger players. Modes of play include Stroke, Match Play, Skins Match, Combination Play, Nearest Pin Contest, Longest Drive Contest, and Challenge.

The six fictitious courses include American, Western, Mountain, Tropical, European, and the special Sky Course. The first four are immediately playable, while the remaining two are unlocked by participating in the one-player Challenge mode. This mode offers players the chance to compete in eight events, such as matches against specific characters and a longest drive contest. Completing six out of the eight events opens up the Mickey Challenge Cup and the final Sky Course in a one-on-one battle with special character Mortimer. Players can also earn tokens while on the links by achieving long putts, perfect swings, and chip-ins.

Source: Wikipedia, "Disney Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94420.name: Shashki Poddavki
94420.description:
Shashki Poddavki (give-away Shashki) is a two-player abstract strategy game from Russia. It is played on the dark squares of an 8x8 Checkers board. The usual rules of Checkers, or rather, Shashki apply -- players may advance their pieces by moving them diagonally to an adjacent black square, and the opponent's pieces may be jumped and captured. However, the game goal is inverted: the player who cannot move anymore first wins.

Shashki Poddavki is a game of skill, yet there is little skill transfer between Shashki and Shashki Poddavki. The games are quite different. Shashki Poddavki has millions of players and its own major tournament scene in Russia.

Shashki Poddavki can be played online at:
* http://www.iggamecenter.com (igGameCenter)
* http://www.checkersland.com/
* http://www.shashki.ru/

94421.name: Omens of War
94421.description:
From the publisher's website:

Omens of War is a valuable resource for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay players and GMs alike, providing new options for martial characters and background on the military of the Empire and the legions of the Ruinous Power Khorne. Players will find several new careers in Omens of War, inspired by the Empire’s militaristic traditions, as well as over 50 new Action cards. The addition of mounted combat rules and horses as a new type of Follower will open new ways to engage your enemies, while new Enhance cards give you more thematic control over your fighting styles.

Game Masters will not only find extensive background on the Blood God Khorne and his legions, they will also discover new ways to challenge their players with Severe Injury rules. These deadly cards are similar to Critical Wounds, however they represent potentially permanent and debilitating wounds that combat in the Old World even more brutal. The Liber Carnagia: The Book of Blood also provides GMs with an all new adventure that will send their players into the thick of battle.

Omens of War comes with two new sourcebooks, over 50 Action cards, 20 Creature cards, 10 Career sheets, and 40 cardboard standups, as well as new Condition, Location, Item, Mutation, Talent, and Severe Injury cards. Additionally, Omens of War also provides all the tokens, handouts, and other materials needed to run the included adventure.

94422.name: Changeling: The Dreaming Introductory Kit
94422.description:
From the Introduction:

Changeling: The Dreaming is a roleplaying game. It is a beautifully illustrated, full-color, hardcover book that explores the hidden world of the faerie folk trapped on Earth. It gives you rules for creating your own changeling character, and describes the setting and history of the fae. What happens next is up to you.

This booklet is a simplified version of Changeling: The Dreaming. It gives you the highlights of the Changeling setting and rules, the core information you need to play a game. Try it out. If you like it, the rulebook is available in most book, hobby and comic stores.

94423.name: Ironclad
94423.description:
Ironclad (known in Japan as Chōtetsu Brikinger) is a shoot 'em up video game developed by Saurus for the Neo Geo CD video game console. It was never officially released in North America, but if you put the game on a North American system, the game will be playable in English and display the "Ironclad" title screen. However, the game was released on the Wii Virtual Console in the PAL region on March 12, 2010 and in North America on April 5, 2010, with both regions as an import release.

A cartridge version was developed, but not available until 2009 when it was released for download in Japan on Nintendo Wii's Virtual Console. Hackers were able to create bootleg Neo-Geo cartridges by extracting the rom, which never surfaced on the internet until then, from the Wii release.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ironclad (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94424.name: Libram Novus #02
94424.description:
From publisher blurb:

Libram Novus #2 continues expanding your Novus universe.

In this issue, we bring you three new classes.

The Shaman - an adventurer who delves into the spirit world.
The Sorcerer - a spellcaster who takes a more scientific view of magic
The Warlock - a practitioner of Black Magic




We also give you spells for both the Shaman and the Sorcerer for thier 2 new schools of magic, and a few new spells for the school of Black Magic.

To round out the issue we provide you with a primer on Planar Cosmology.

94425.name: Glide: Tabletop Shuffleboard
94425.description:
From the company website:

"Introducing Glide the fold-up tabletop shuffleboard game that's sure to be a hit with young and old alike!

Take aim and carefully push the handmade GLIDE stones across the supersonically slippery board to land in the target. With a 4 foot long board, only the most skilled will have the aim to knock an opponent out!"

The game is similar in gameplay to actual shuffleboard and also to Sorry! Sliders board game. Each player shoots his stones down a 4' board, attempting to stop them inside of the bullseye. Players are awarded 25-100 points based on where their stones end up by the end of each round.

94426.name: Whac-A-Critter
94426.description:
Text from the back of the box

Bash, Crash, Thrash and Smash your way to the top!!!

Remember Whac-A-Mole at the Arcade? Well, here's your chance to Whac-A-Cat, Whac-A-Mouse, Whac-A-Monster - but DON'T Whac-A-Dog or Whac-A-Princess! If you do, you lose!!

Works with a standard Sega Genesis Controller but is totally intense with the SMASH controller. Designed for years of bashing and smashing (see below), the Smash Controller is Sega Genesis Smash games.

Whac-A-Critter has 6 levels in all - But we bet you can't make it to the end. No one ever has! Wanna try?

The SMASH controller (not included) is available at patricipating stores.

94427.description:
Match "alike" I Spy objects and numbers. Great for fun on the run...Games to Go!

Contents: 24 double-sided Link-Alike dominos

Objective: Use up all your dominos by linking them to dominos with matching objects or numbers.

There are three different game plays: 1) Link-Alikes; 2) Square-Alikes; 3) Bingo-Alikes.

Matches are not all the same exact image, but are of the same object category. Images do have an associated word that is the same to assure the match is appropriate.
94427.name: I SPY Link-Alikes

94428.name: Magister (Issue 30 - Sep 1991)
rpgissuearticle: De Kronieken - H.P. Lovecraft en de Cthulhu mythologie
Recensie - Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles & Other Strangeness
94428.description:
Magister
Nummer 30 - september 1991
Issue 30 - September 1991

Cover art by Arno Vriends

94429.name: The Archers
94429.description:
The Archers is a board game by Chad Valley from the 1960s based in the world of the BBC radio series 'The Archers' and set in the fictional town of Borchester. The game includes animal tokens, paper banknotes, a linen bag and an auctioneer's gavel. There are six farm cards representing Allards Farm, Brookfield Farm, Heydon Farm, Coombe Farm, Barratts Farm and Manor Farm, and six player tokens representing the owner of each farm. The rules allow for a seventh player to act as banker/auctioneer.

Each player starts with £200, a farm card and a farmer token. Players roll dice to make their way around the game board, following any instructions on the spaces they land on. When players reach the central market area, an auction is held to purchase animal tokens drawn from the linen bag. Once three animals have been auctioned, players move around the Market Square spaces before the market closes. Players then return home and play restarts from the starting square.

Each player places any animals they obtain onto their personal farm board. A tractor must also be bought during the game. The winner is the first player to have a complete farm.

94430.name: Signs & Portents (Issue 90 - Mar 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Ships of Houses Decados and Hawkwood
The City of Lof: Uncovered Part II
rpg: Judge Dredd the Roleplaying Game (MGP Traveller)
94430.description:
From the introduction by Nick Robinson:

So what is in this month’s Signs and Portents, I hear you ask (in a pleading, please don’t hurt me kind of way)?

The second part to the excellent article on Shamanism in RuneQuest kicks off this issue, with more spirits that you can shake a British secret agent at. An interesting little piece on making money (one of my favourite pastimes) for Traveller is also featured with a nice little adventure attached.

A second scenario, this time for the superb Deus Vult, is our third major feature this month, with funny goings-on in Normandy (aren’t there always?).

94432.name: Magister (Issue 31 - Nov 1991)
rpgissuearticle: Pas Op! Loslopende NPC's! - Deel 5: Het Museum
94432.description:
Magister
Nummer 31 - november 1991
Issue 31 - November 1991

Cover art by Arno Vriends.

Magister #31 is a special issue about art and culture.

Includes the board game CYBERGANS 2000, a modern version of the old Game of the Goose (middle pages, can be taken out).

94433.name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
94433.description:
Can you keep it from falling!

Leaning Tower of Pisa is a stacking game. Players first take turns adding pieces to construct the entire tower, then if it is still standing, pieces are removed one by one (not from the top level) until the tower collapses. The loser is either the player who adds the piece which causes the tower to fall in the construction phase, or the player who removes the piece causing the collapse in the removal phase.

The tower itself is made up of eight levels, each level having six pieces which can be removed, a central support piece and a flat 'floor' piece. The full tower stands about 33cm tall (13in).

There is also a sloping base piece which can be used for a more difficult challenge. Starting with this piece means that the whole tower is on an angle (like the real Leaning Tower) and is much more unstable.

94436.name: One
94436.description:
The goal of One is for the player to discover the identity of the main character John Cain. The only clue available is a barcode on the player-character's neck. At the beginning of the game, John Cain awakens on the floor of an apartment building, with a gun in place of one arm, no memory, and police helicopters shooting missiles through a window. The player is pursued across the city and country-side by military and police forces who are apparently intending to kill Cain. To combat the police and military forces and other enemies, the player has the option to use Cain's newly installed arm cannon, or rely on more traditional fighting weapons like punch and kicking combos.

Source: Wikipedia, "One (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94437.name: Golden Nugget
94437.description:
From the back of the box
Immerse yourself in the Golden Nugget and you'll enjoy Las Vegas style casino gaming in a four-star casino paradise with 16 games of chance to challenge and thrill you. This is virtual nonstop casino action with all the authenticity of the real thing.

Features: More than 30 minutes of live action video starring Adam West (Batman) filmed on location at the GOLDEN NUGGET.

94438.name: Reichsgold: Aachen bei Nacht
94438.description:
User Summary: Aachen city sourcebook for Vampire: the Dark Ages.

From the back cover:
Aachen in der Alten Welt: die Stadt Karls des Großen. Krönungsstätte für edle Häupter, Sitz der Könige des Reiches. Im Laufe der Jahrhunderte wird Aachen von einer römischen Badetherme zur prunkstrotzenden Feste hochherrschaftlicher Geschlechter. Die Faust, die Zepter, Recht und Gesetz hält, ist eisern. Von leichtem Lebensstil verwöhnt gleitet das an die Dunkelheit gewöhnte Auge des Betrachters weiter durch die Nacht in der Stadt der Kaiser, vorbei an trutzigen, romanischen Kapellen und den einprägsamen architektonischen Denkmälern, der Macht Karls des Großen him zu den martialischen Erbstücken seines Wirkens, him zu der Verwirklichung eines Traums- eines Traums aus Gold, Marmor und Stein, eines Traums, den Karls des Großen das Oktogon nannte.

Aachen bei Nacht enthält:

- Eine ausführliche beschreibung Aachens im finsteren Mittelalter nebst allen Kainiten und allerlei sonstigen Wesenheiten sowie

- "Schwarz", eine spielbereite Geschichte, die die Charaktere mitten in die Ränke der mittelalterlichen Kaiserstadt stürzt.

Reichsgold ist ein offizieller Spielhintergrund zu Vampire aus der Alten Welt, der NUR in deutscher Sprache existiert.

Google Translate (partial):
Aachen by Night contains:
- A detailed description of Aachen in the dark ages along with all the children of Cain and all sorts of other entities and

- "Black", a play-ready story, which plunges the characters in the midst of the intrigues of the medieval imperial city.

Reichsgold is an official game background to vampires from the Old World, which only exists in German.

94439.name: Newtonia: Civil War on the Missouri Border
boardgamefamily: Battles of the American Civil War
94439.description:
Published in September 2007 issue of LPD newsletter "Special Operations" are a Print & Play game Newtonia - Civil War on the Missouri Border, debuting the new Orders system for the Battles of the American Civil War game series (same as Battle of Honey Springs).

"Newtonia is a game designed to test new rules concepts for the Battles of the American Civil War series. There were two battles outside this tiny Missouri town, one in 1862 as the Confederacy sought to tap the agricultural produce and mineral resources of the surrounding region, and another in late 1864 when Sterling Price’s Army of Missouri sought a brief rest during its retreat after the Battle of Westport. Each scenario exemplifies a different tactical situation.

I Newtonia shows a Federal “demonstration” against the town. A “Demonstration”, in Civil War parlance, is a threatened attack on a stronger enemy which doesn’t actually intend to get heavily involved. Demonstrations are economy of force missions, occupying a larger enemy to support other operations. Here, a “Demonstration” simply reminds the Confederates that there was an active opponent in the areas.

II Newtonia is a classic delaying action. Both armies are fatigued and at the limit of battle worthiness. In addition, Confederate morale was low because of their defeat at Westport, lack of food and absence of any meaningful time to rest. The Federal army is buoyed up by their victory, but is equally tired and hungry."

94440.name: Pack-Rat
94440.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pack-Rat: The rodent that walks like a man... a cunning rat mutated into humanoid form, with a knack for taking the castoffs of modern society, both technological and human, and turning them to his advantage. Pack-Rat is a thief and gadget-maker, and his "Rats in the Walls" know every shadow of the city.

94441.name: Junkpile
94441.description:
From publisher blurb:

Junkpile: This is what you get when you cross a freak weather event with technology of unknown origin, in a junkyard. But it's no joke.

94442.name: Doctor Shock
94442.description:
From publisher blurb:

Obsessed with discovering the science behind superpowers, Dr. Gordon Shockley was delighted to develop powers of his own. But when they started killing him, his scientific cure took things a bit too far...

94443.name: Project Overkill
94443.description:
The gameplay takes on a 3d-esque isometric view, in which the player chooses one of four mercenaries to lead through the levels. The characters act as lives, and if one were killed, the player still has the choice among the remaining mercenaries (rather than having multiple lives for one character). In the levels, the player must find keycards, destroy guards, aliens, and robots, activate laser bridges, to complete an objective. Objectives include finding the exit to the level, assassination of an officer, escorting a defect or other important official, retrieving an item (usually a memory chip or the like), or obtaining a certain percentage of kills in the area.

The four characters available to the player are for the most-part alike, but each have key differences that make them noticeably set apart from the rest. For example, the large alien, Quogg, has a melee attack that will kill the standard human troops in just one hit (rather than the two required from the other characters). Also, each character has slight variations in weaponry that make for somewhat different combat experiences.

Source: Wikipedia, "Project Overkill," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94444.name: Fallout
94444.description:
From publisher blurb:

Major Emerson Cord volunteered to be turned into a nuclear-powered superhero. Instead he became a bitter, paranoid, psychotic, living nuclear furnace with a big grudge against those responsible for his condition. Along with everyone else..

94445.name: Tackle!
94445.description:
Tackle! is a football (soccer) game possibly dating from the 1960s. The object of the game is to score the most goals. Players each have a team of 11 footballers represented by small plastic tokens. One team is red and the other is blue. The playing pieces fit into holes in the board which is a football pitch marked out into hex spaces. There is a token for the football which can slot into the board or into the top of the footballer playing pieces to denote possession.

On a player's turn, they may choose one of three actions: 1. Move a player with the ball up to five spaces in the direction they are facing then (optional) turn and pass the ball, 2. Move a player off the ball, 3. Attempt to tackle an opposing player. There are additional rules governing the movement of goalkeepers.

From the box: "Tactical football for 2 players - move, turn and kick away!"

94446.name: Gothic Checkers
94446.description:
Gothic Checkers is an old German draughts variant (know as "Altdeutsche Dame" in Germany), which was influenced by Turkish Draughts. It is played on an 8x8 square board. Each player starts with 16 stones, 8 on each of the two back ranks. Soldiers move one cell diagonally forward and capture in any of the five cells directly forward, diagonally forward, or sideways. Soldiers promote on the last row. Kings may move and attack in any of the eight directions. Kings can only attack adjacent pieces. The player who captures all enemy stones wins. If there are several choices, the player must capture the largest number.

Variant:

Kings move and capture in any distance like the so-called flying kings in Dama (Turkish Draughts) or International Draughts.

94447.name: Anvil
94447.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anvil: Donnie Moore was always a boorish, motorcycle-riding (and motorcycle-stealing) brawler. Thanks to the effects of the Silver Storm, he's now also now super-dense, super-strong, and nigh invincible. And he's having the time of his life.

94448.name: King Babylon
94448.description:
From publisher blurb:

King Babylon: Ravenous for money, fame, and power, King Babylon sows the seeds of chaos everywhere he goes.

94449.name: Mindfire
94449.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mindfire: A sociopath with psionic powers, she has no regard for who she hurts or what powerful organizations she angers.

94450.name: Tribal
94450.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tribal: The Silver Storm granted Jorge Hurtado the power to communicate with and assume the abilities of wild animals. He wants to figure out how to use his new powers to become king of the urban jungle.

94451.name: The Mustang
94451.description:
From the One Seven Design website:

You’re crouched outside the lair of the mustang, near the burned tree. Your friends are with you, exchanging nervous looks. Like you, they’re having second thoughts. Like you, they smell death on the air and wonder if it’s their deaths.

Cassie has a big piece of sheet metal with a rope across the back, because the Mustang breathes fire. Jack has a rifle, because the Mustang is far too swift to catch. William has a bible, because the Mustang is the Devil’s steed. You have a knife because, in the end, someone has to cut the Mustang’s throat.


It’s the witching hour, the moon is full, and fresh blood is on the ground. The Mustang will surely run tonight.


The Mustang is a western gothic horror module for 4 people. It contains a starting situation, characters, and quick-play rules for a fast one-session game.

94452.name: Richie Rich Big Money Game
94452.description:
The Richie Rich Big Money Game was created in 1977 by Pressman and sold exclusively through ads in the back of Richie Rich Comics.

The game is roll-and-move, with players taking turns at dollar bill shaped spinner. Space include positive and negative dollar amounts, making this a watered down children's version of Monopoly, though there is no buying or selling involved. Occasionally cards are drawn which will augment or deplete a player's cash reserves.

When players amass a million dollars, they may enter the winner's circle by exact count. The first person to get there wins.

Based on the original comics (as opposed to the 80's cartoon) the game is extremely rare and, outside of the first few comic book issues, has become one of the most sought-after Richie Rich collectibles.

94453.name: Magister (Issue 32 - Jan 1992)
rpgissuearticle: Recensie - Tales from the Floating Vagabond
94453.description:
Magister
Nummer 32 - januari 1992
Issue 32 - January 1992

Cover art by Arno Vriends

94454.name: High Frontier Poster Map
94454.description:
This expansion includes all of the High Frontier basic and expanded maps, but extended to Pluto and the Kuiper Belt. And Alpha Centauri, but you are going to need bigger rockets!

The 2013 edition is designed to work with the Colonization expansion, and extends all the way out to Sedna and the EM Sunlens point.

94455.name: Schlaue Köpfchen
94455.description:
Educational game that adults can play with kids two and up. The players take turns rolling a color die and moving to the next field in the respective color. There are three field colors with corresponding task types - trivia, construction (to be done with foam bricks) and fitness (in which the players have to do some physical exercise).
When a player fails to fulfill a task, s/he can still proceed in the next turn. When a player reaches the finish line, a lst task is presented and the game ends.
Cards for two year olds are marked and can be taken out when playing with older kids.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

94456.name: Color Stix
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 481 - Meeplefest Night 2, Part 3
94456.description:
Qwirkle designer Susan McKinley Ross offers a new take on pick-up sticks, one that might be called "pick up the sticks, then put them down again in a pleasing arrangement" but is thankfully better titled Color Stix.

Color Stix includes 42 brightly-colored sticks – with seven colored rectangles on each stick – along with a 90-second timer. In the first round of the game, each player takes 7-10 sticks, holds them together in one hand, then drops them on the table once the timer starts. Players then arrange and rearrange the sticks to place similarly colored rectangles adjacent to one another and form large blocks of a single color.

Once time runs out, players score points for each color block of at least two rectangles, with each block worth as many points as the number of rectangles in it. Players then pass their sticks clockwise and play another round. After as many rounds as the number of players in the game, the player with the highest score wins.

94457.name: Math-A-Kazam!
94457.description:
In fantasy literature, wizards cast spells, control weather and call forth otherworldly creatures. In the real world, however, the "wizards" are actually mathematicians, who use their magic powers of multiplication, subtraction and other operations to transform numbers into a different form.

In Math-A-Kazam! players try their hand at this math wizardry, using a magnetic wand to pull magnetic number chips from a bowl and creating equations as they do so. The game includes sixty regular number chips (six each 0-9) and ten "gold-rimmed Magic Jewel" number chips (0-9).

On a turn, a player has 30 seconds in which to create an equation. Players must pull chips from the cauldron one at a time and state the equation as they draw each chip, although they can change the equation in mid-play if they can't find the number they need or come across better chips. Equations are created strictly from left to right, ending with the sum or product of the equation with the operators mentally added by the active player. (A variant for math fiends suggests following the order of operations instead of reading the equation from left to right.)

If a player drops a chip while drawing it from the bowl or fails to create an equation before time runs out, then the player returns all chips to the bowl and ends his turn. Otherwise, he keeps all chips used in his equation.

Math-A-Kazam! ends once all the chips have been claimed or no more equations can be created. Each normal chips is worth one point; each Magic Jewel chip worth two. The player with the most points wins.

94459.name: Mega Man Star Force 3
videogameversion: North American DS Black Ace edition
North American DS Red Joker edition
94459.description:
User Summary

Mega Man Star Force 3 is an action RPG title in the Star Force series. Players control Geo Stelar, a fifth grade student who can transform into Mega Man in order to travel through the wave world – an EM based environment.

Gameplay is based in both the physical and wave worlds. While in the physical world, Geo is able to view the wave world by using his Visualizer. When transformed, Mega Man can travel through the wave world on a series of roads comprised of radio waves. These roads are littered with viruses that will attack randomly.

Battles are fought on a 3D grid, with the camera behind Mega Man. The Mega Buster can always be used to attack, but more powerful attacks require Battle Cards to be equipped. Star Force 3 introduces the Noise feature – Mega Man increases his Noise percentage by defeating enemies, and as the percentage increases, more abilities are unlocked.

Star Force 3 was released in two versions – Black Ace and Red Joker. Gameplay is identical in both flavours, but certain transformations and Battle Cards are unique to a single version.

94460.name: Rockman Battle & Fighters
videogameversion: Japanese Neo Geo Pocket Color edition
94460.description:
User Summary

Rockman Battle & Fighters is a fighting game in the Mega Man franchise released exclusively in Japan for the Neo Geo Pocket Color. The game is a compilation of two arcade fighting games – Mega Man: The Power Battle and Mega Man 2: The Power Fighters. Although the gameplay and storylines have been retained from the original games, the graphics were downgraded to 8-bit sprite models. In addition, much of the original music has been removed from the game. Only Mega Man’s theme song is included in the game.

94461.name: Rockman & Forte: Challenger from the Future
94461.description:
User Summary

Rockman & Forte: Challenger from the Future is a platformer released exclusively in Japan for the WonderSwan. In the year 20XX, a group of robots called the Dimensions attacks Symphony City, led by a mysterious robot similar to Rockman (Mega Man). This robot calls himself Rockman Shadow. Both Rockman and Forte (Bass) are dispatched to deal with the problem, the former by Dr. Light and the latter by Dr. Wily.

Players can choose to play as either Rockman or Forte, each of whom has a unique moveset. Rockman controls the same as he does in other games in the Mega Man series and is able to charge his Mega Buster and slide. Forte, on the other hand, has a rapid fire weapon that can only be fired while immobile and the ability to dash and double jump. There are six robot Masters in the game:

- Konro Man
- Aircon Man
- Komuso Man
- Dangan Man
- Clock Man
- Compas Man

It is possible to purchase special bonuses and upgrades using bolts that can be found in the different levels and as random pickups.

94462.name: Rockman Power Battle Fighters
94462.description:
User Summary

Rockman Power Battle Fighters is a fighting compilation title in the Mega Man franchise. The game includes the arcade fighters Mega Man: The Power Battle and Mega Man 2: The Power Fighters. The gameplay and storylines have been maintained from their original arcade versions, but Power Battle Fighters includes a new 2 player versus mode and unlockable bonus modes.

Players can choose to play as Rockman (Mega Man), Blues (Proto Man), or Forte (Bass) as they duel against Robot Masters from Mega Man 1-7. Defeating a Robot Master unlocks their weapon for use in later stages. The Power Fighters adds Duo as a playable character.

94463.name: Super Adventure Rockman
94463.description:
User Summary

Super Adventure Rockman is an interactive anime mini-series combined with a first person shooter. Dr. Wily finds an ancient supercomputer that he uses to revive many of his former Robot Masters and disable all the robots in the world, including Rockman’s sister Roll. Dr. Light manages to create a shield for Rockman and his allies, Rush and Beat, and Rockman sets out to stop Dr. Wily and save Roll.

The game plays similarly to a “Choose Your Own Adventure” book – players watch the video, and are periodically prompted to choose a response or action by Rockman. There are a number of quicktime events that force the player to dodge out of the way by moving to one side of the screen, and each boss fight plays light a first person stationary shooter.

Rockman will acquire a special weapon each time he defeats a Robot Master, and these weapons can be used alongside his Mega Buster in later boss battles. Pickups such as Energy and Weapon tanks can also be found as the game progresses.

94464.name: Rockman Complete Works
94464.description:
User Summary

Rockman Complete Works is a compilation release of the original six Mega Man titles. The game was only released in Japan, but most of the features were later included in the global release of Mega Man Anniversary Collection.

The graphics, gameplay, and storylines were all kept nearly identical to their original releases, but the developers included a number of additions to enhance the games:

- Navi Mode provides additional information and hints to aid players during gameplay. The number of remaining special weapon uses and tips on which way to go are provided.
- The weapon subscreens were redone to be more intuitive.
- Remixed music was added for Mega Man 4-6.
- The shoulder buttons can be used to switch special weapons.
- Games can be saved to a memory card.
- An enemy database is kept, and information is updated for every enemy encountered.

94465.name: Wily & Right no RockBoard: That's Paradise
94465.description:
User Summary

Wily & Right no Rockboard: That’s Paradise is a Monopoly-style party game set in the Mega Man universe. Players can choose to play as one of five characters: Dr. Light, Dr. Wily, Dr. Cossack, Roll, or Kalinka. They then travel around the board purchasing property that they land on. If they land on an opponent’s property, they must pay that player the required rent. Owning a chain of adjacent properties increases the rent for all of those spaces.

RockBoard differs from Monopoly in that players can purchase a lab on a piece of property currently owned by another player. If they do, the rent is split between the two parties. Labs can be upgraded by board events or landing on the property again, and they can also be bought by other players at any time for a marked up price. There is also a “Robot Transform” square that turns a player into a Robot Master for a period of time, during which they have special abilities. The winning conditions include reaching a required amount of money, labs, or property.

94466.name: The Untouchables
videogamehonor: 1990 Golden Joystick Game of the Year Winner (8-bit)
94466.description:
A side-scrolling video game was released by Ocean Software in 1989 on ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, MSX, Amiga, MS-DOS, and later on NES, and SNES. Based loosely on the movie, the game plays out some of the more significant parts of the film. Set in Chicago, the primary goal of the game is to take down Al Capone's henchmen and eventually detain Capone.

Source: Wikipedia, "Untouchables (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94467.name: Rockman EXE WS
94467.description:
User Summary

Rockman EXE WS is a platforming title in the Battle Network series. It combines many gameplay features from the original Mega Man series with the story and events of the Battle Network series.

Players control Megaman.EXE, a NetNavi tied to Lan Hikari, and attempt to destroy viruses unleashed by WWW. Stages are set up as side-scrolling dungeons filled with pits, spikes, and enemies. Megaman can get aid from Lan, however, in the form of Battle Chips. Each Battle Chip provides a one-time special power, but players need to keep track of their connection meter – if the meter drops too low, Megaman cannot connect with Lan, and his help line will be cut off.

94468.name: Tai-Pan
94468.description:
Cassette Inlay

Now from the author of top seller SHOGUN, James Clavell, comes TAI PAN and a terrific computer game simulation packed with action and stunning graphics. TAI PAN is the exciting story of a man and an island. Become Dirk Struan - a pirate, a smuggler, a manipulator of men achieving riches beyond imagination. Enter a world of blood, sin, treachery, conspiracy and murder - a game of Grand entertainment!

94469.name: Worse Things Happen At Sea
94469.description:
User Summary

You play the role of a robot aboard a cargo ship and it is your job to fix leaks and keep the ship on course to it's destination, where you hope to make a profit after paying the costs of pumping out the water and replacing your robots.

94470.name: Genesis 3 Button Controller
videogamehwversion: Japanese SJ-3500 Mega Drive 3 Button Controller
North American Model 1650 v1 Genesis 3 Button Controller
North American Model 1650 v2 Genesis 3 Button Controller
North American Model 1650 v3 Genesis 3 Button Controller
PAL v1 Mega Drive 3 Button Controller
PAL v1.1 Mega Drive 3 Button Controller
PAL v2 Mega Drive 3 Button Controller
94470.description:
User Summary

The 3 button Genesis controller is basic controller originally released with Genesis and Mega Drive. The controller has 3 play buttons (A, B, & C), a D-Pad, and Start button.

The controller utilized three different D-Pad designs. The early ones used an internal plastic nub that tended to wear out. The middle ones used a metal ball bearing that did not wear out easily. The final ones that were released used a two part D-Pad mechanism. This type also tended to wear out over time.

94471.description:
This is an extension for Dice Town.

Here the new features :

- 6th player (1 bullet and 5 dice)
- Indian expansion included
- 6 new actions (the 2nd best player have an action on each phase)
- 51 new cards (including two new types : Wanted mobsters and River cards)
- 10 1$ bills and 10 nuggets

Publisher Blurb:

More riches, more fun and even more tactic: rediscover Dice Town!

You think you know everything there is to know about the city of Dice Town? Discover its seedy underbelly: pan for gold in the river, buy new merchandise from the General Store, hire bandits, hunt down outlaws, control ranches, ally with the Indians.

From now on, nothing will ever be the same!

This expansion for Dice Town allows the addition of a 6th player. But it also offers multiple new possibilities that make the game even more tactical, rich and lively starting with 2 players.

Features:

- Lots of new game situations, including ranches and outlaws
- More fun and more strategy!
- Allows a 6th player to play
- Includes the famous Indian die!
94471.name: Dice Town: Extension
boardgamepodcastepisode: #41: Six Awesome Uses of Dice; Roll Player on tap; Kingdomino; Noch Mal!; Women in Beer
Session Impressions: Dice Town: A Fist Full of Dice!

94472.name: Tee-Off Championship Golf
94472.description:
Tee-Off Championship Golf is a game from the 1970s. Players simulate an 18 hole round of golf on a double sided board. This is accomplised by rolling dice to determine how far a player's shot travels, with cards being played to modify the outcome.

From the box: "Tee-Off - Championship Golf - The Great Board Game. Tee-Off reproduces the tactical thinking and thrills of championship golf. What scores will you achieve in this exciting, skilful and totally absorbing game, can you shoot a course record? 9 different types of golf game can be played. As in the real game it takes both luck and skill to shoot the best scores."

94473.description:
This is an Advanced Tobruk System expansion game that allows players to recreate squad-level action from World War II. This expansion game, like all complete games and expansion games in the Advanced Tobruk System, uses the same ruleset from the system rulebook. Gameplay is the same for all games and expansions. It also comes with a Battlefield Walkaround booklet that points out landscape and terrain features specific to the game’s maps, and a few game-specific rules to reflect the unique circumstances the title portrays. Rules additions and changes are kept to a minimum allowing players to get started right away!

In ATS, players alternate using impulses to move and fire infantry squads, armored vehicles and Heavy Weapons, to fulfill or deny completion of a scenario’s Victory Conditions. Each scenario sets the victory conditions that one side must complete to be victorious, and the opposing player must prevent. Draws are sometimes possible. The counters have the overhead view of AFVs and vehicles debuted in wargaming with Avalon Hill’s TOBRUK. Vehicles and guns come on 3/4" counters, infantry on a 5/8" counters, and status markers remain on 1/2" counters.

Each new game or expansion in ATS drops you into a historical theater, and a specific locale within to give you an up close, and sometimes eyeball to eyeball perspective, with scenarios based or inspired by historical actions, all at 50 yards per hex.

This Expansion comes with 2 large historical linking maps covering the firefights near Ponyri Station, during the Battle of Kursk, 1943. Includes 18 scenarios on the 18th Panzer Division's assault against Soviet fortified positions. Most scenarios play on one map. One "monster" scenario uses both maps.

ATS Ponyri component list:

2 linking mapsheets
18 scenarios on 11 cards
1 Battlefield Walkaround booklet
2 small countersheets (5 rows with zb obr 39 25|A H|AA in upper left corner)
1 countersheet German Personnel
1 countersheet EF1
1 countersheet ATS New Russian Personnel 1

NOT A COMPLETE GAME.

Ownership of any Eastern Front ATS complete game is required to play this expansion.
94473.name: ATS: Ponyri – Metalgods

94474.name: Mutant Fighter
94474.description:
User Summary

A fighting game with a fantasy theme.

94475.name: Mutation Nation
94475.description:
Mutation Nation is a beat 'em up arcade game that was developed and released by SNK for the Neo Geo Japanese arcade and home systems in 1991 while the English versions were released in 1992.

In 2050 a mad scientist was shut down by his superiors after conducting bizarre biological experiments. However soon after, his lab exploded and the scientist himself mysteriously disappeared. Now several years later there are new buildings on top of the forgotten slum where the experiments took place and suddenly a genetic virus has started to spread among the tenants turning them into vicious mutants. The two protagonists return to town after having been away for a long time and upon seeing what is happening they take it upon themselves to clean the town up before the mutants spread across the nation. Along the way they come across not just the mutants but also mechanically modified foes that the mad scientist has created to stop them.

One or two players fight their way through the five levels of various mutated and mechanic enemies, each level containing one or more sub-bosses before an actual boss appears at the end of each stage. The game plays close to the usual beat 'em up mold allowing the player to utilize various combos, jumping attacks, throws and special moves to utilize on the opposition. Rather than the standard fare of allowing players to pick up objects to use as weapons against the enemy however, Mutation Nation instead uses a system where the player can pick up one of four elemental spheres that allows the player the ability to unleash screen filling super attacks. There are also neutral spheres that will give life back to the player and increase the number of super attacks that they can use.

These are the various elemental spheres that can be picked up by the player and used for special attacks. Each sphere is represented by a letter and color that helps the player tell them apart. If the players don’t have any spheres available they can instead sacrifice part of their life meter to unleash a flurry of attacks.

•Light - Red with the letter A written on it. The light sphere unleashes the fastest but also least damaging attack in the game. The player explodes into two bodies of light that shoot out in opposite directions before coming back together to reform the body after the enemies have been knocked down.
•Fire - This sphere is represented by the letter B and has a reddish color. It unleashes a large explosion from the players hands which does heavy damage to everything on screen.
•Lightning - The lightning sphere has a blue color and the letter C. The attack it produces is by far the slowest attack in the game but it doesn't matter much because the player is invincible for the duration of the entire animation. The character will jump up off screen and come down a few moments later hitting the ground to create lightning streaks that go off in all directions for moderate damage.
•Wind - The last sphere is green and has the letter D on it. It unleashes the most powerful attack in the game where the player turns into a massive green tornado that will travel back and forth over the screen, mowing down everything in its path often hitting more than once for massive damage.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mutation Nation", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94476.description:
A solitaire 'In-Your-Hand' style game lasting about 10 minutes

You are the governor of a new colony, part of the West Islandia Trading Company. Your job is to produce tradegoods, recruit colonists and make as much gold for the West Islandia Trading Company as you can, while working your way once through the deck of cards. If you make it completely through the deck without losing all of your colonists you have won and may then count up your Victory Points to see how well you governed.
To play you'll need the 54 game cards, Colony Map card, and 10-12 small paperclips.

There are 4 types of cards in the game:

Purple - Ship tradegoods for gold
Gray - Produce tradegoods for later sale
Green - Upgrades and expansions to your colony
Red - Hazards




Play: Deal one card from the bottom of the deck face-up on top of the Colony Map, centered in the game title section, with the 3 numbers facing up. Then deal a second card face up on top of the first so the 3 punched holes align with the 3 numbers underneath. These 3 numbers are used to determine resource values during the action on the top card.

Read the text on the top card and complete the action. You may gain or lose gold, colonists or tradegoods. Anytime you see a colored circle icon referenced in the action text, look at the number above, in the matching colored circle, for its value. After an action is completed, discard both cards to a pocket. Then draw two new cards.

You cannot have more than a maximum of 9 Colonists during the game. The Gold track, located at the top of the Colony Map, will allow you to bank up to 299 gold.
The bottom Tradegoods track will allow you to store a maximum of 20 tradegoods unless you build one or two of the Warehouses (each costs 10 gold), then you can store up to 10 additional tradegoods in each warehouse for a game maximum of 40 tradegoods. The righthand track lists various Trading Company Employee bonus upgrades. Add extra paperclips as needed to the gold and tradegoods tracks for the 10s and 100s placemarkers.

Employees: The five Trading Company Employees on the righthand track each have a gold cost listed to hire them and a value in VP. You may hire each employee once, sliding a paperclip on top of them to mark them as hired.

The Shipwright (cost 20 gold) lets you add +1 to the tradegood number inside the circle at the top of the card when you produce tradegoods
The Recruiter (cost 20 gold) lets you add +1 to the colonist number inside the circle at the top of the card when you gain colonists
The Trader (cost 20 gold) lets you add +1 to the gold number inside the circle at the top of the card when you ship tradegoods
The Advocate (cost 30 gold) lets you subtract -1 to any number inside the circles at the top of the card when referenced on the red Hazard cards
The Financier (cost 40 gold) lets you ignore all red Hazard cards stating you must pay Shareholders.
94476.name: New World Colony
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cubepushers - Episode 3: To Theme Or Not To Theme

94477.name: Mystic Riders
94477.description:
User Summary

I side scrolling shoot 'em up where you play broom flying witches that collect power ups, shoot in all 8 directions, and use magic to pass levels.

Play through 6 different levels to beat the game. Fight stronger and stronger bosses to defeat the game.

Graphics border on animated and are very cutesy. Play style is similar to most side-scrolling flying shooters.

94478.name: NAM-1975
94478.description:
NAM-1975 is a 1990 war-themed action shooting game released by SNK. It was the first game released for Neo Geo arcade and home platform, and the only title to not feature the Neo Geo logo in its attract mode.

"The roar of the helicopters overhead snaps us back into reality. We will never forget the nightmare of that summer..." these were the phrases that started the story of Silver & Brown (the names used to describe the two available players).

The game is set in a very fictional account of the final months of the Vietnam War. The story begins with the two soldiers entering the war to rescue Dr. R. Muckly, an ex-scientist of the American Army, who has been kidnapped by Northside Terrorists. Nancy Muckly, Dr. Muckly's daughter has also been kidnapped and is presumed imprisoned in the NAM interior.

However, as the game progresses, the armies learn that Dr. R. Muckly is a madman who is building a gigantic laser cannon to take over the world himself (the final boss battle was infamous for disallowing continues, except by modifying the DIP switch).

There are many references to many famous Vietnam War films in the game, such as Apocalypse Now and Full Metal Jacket: the attract sequence showing one of the characters firing off an M60 machine gun is clearly ported from the shot of Animal Mother firing on the VC sniper in the latter film.

NAM featured two types of weapons:

Shooting weapons

Standard Machine Gun
Balcan: a more powerful machine gun.
Missile: a missile launcher that explodes, clearing enemies within its range.
Fire: a flamethrower that scorches enemies within its path.
Throwing weapons

Grenade: defeats enemies with a concussive blast.
Spark Bomb: a more powerful grenade that triggers other explosions.
Napalm Bomb: a grenade that clears all enemies from the area.
Techniques:

Walk: Press Left or Right
Run: Press Left or Right + Button
Flip (Parry): Diagonal-Left or Diagonal-Right + Button
In addition, by saving a hostage, the hostage will help you by shooting at enemies.

Source: Wikipedia, "NAM-1975", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94479.name: T-72
94479.description:
designer summary

This playset for Bully Pulpit's game, Fiasco, is set inside a T-72 main battle tank in Afghanistan, 1981. The oil's leaking, the mountains are full of fanatic mujahadeen, and the loader drank most of the brake fluid.

T-72 is a free product released under the Creative Commons Attribute (CC BY) license.

94480.description:
From BGG News (Eric Martin): "In Pantheon, players enact the comings and goings of various peoples in the Mediterranean: Egyptians, Romans, Iberians, Germans, etc. They accumulate as many raw materials as possible to build monuments to the gods, but the ways of the gods are unpredictable.

"On a turn, a player has a number of options. He can choose to travel with his people by using the big wooden footprint piece, then smaller footpints to mark their path and block other players. He can buy materials to worship the gods: dancers, farm produce, impressive temples, or prayers. He can use these offerings to take a god token, which may grant him special abilities as well as victory points. Finally, he may build monuments that are worth victory points at the end of the game. The game lasts six rounds with two scoring periods."
94480.name: Pantheon
boardgamepodcastepisode: RSOG Podcast Episode 1
The Gaming Gang Episode 25: Pantheon, Sekigahara, Quack in the Box, Fantasy Craft and More
The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Hans im Gluck

94481.description:
The baby chicks have flown the coop! All players work together to help Mother Hen collect her chicks and bring them back to the coop. To start, players place the 40 baby chicks all around the board. Mother Hen is on start. The object of the game is to get all 40 baby chicks back inside the coop before Mother Hen gets to the last space on the board. Players spin and move Mother Hen, counting the number of spaces she travels. For each space travelled, players collect that number of baby chick markers and place them in the coop. But watch out for the fox! If the spinner lands on the fox a baby chick is removed from the coop. Players take turns, but work together - players count aloud together, collect the number chicks together and, if they collect them all, players win together!

Components:

1 game board
1 mother hen with stand
40 baby chick markers
1 spinner
94481.name: Count Your Chickens!

94482.name: Der letzte Held (Issue 44 - Oct 2001)
94482.description:
User summary

Main features in this issue:

Blutiger Schnee - DSA adventure
Review of Kirchen, Kulte, Ordenskrieger
Nachtschatten - DSA solitaire adventure

94483.description:
In Hoot Owl Hoot! the players want to move all the owls back to their nest before the sun rises and the new days begins.

To set up the game, place the sun token on the first place of the sun track, place three owls on the starting spaces of the owl track, and gave three cards to each player; the fifty-card deck includes 36 color cards (six each in six colors) and 14 sun cards. Players keep their cards face up in front of them so that they can work together to strategize how to move. If a player has a sun card, on her turn she must discard the sun and move the sun token one space; if she has all color cards, she discards any one color card, then moves any owl to the next open space of that color. If an owl "flies" over an owl on a space of that color on its way to the next open space, all players make a hooting sound!

Hoot Owl Hoot!, along with its European counterpart Flieg mit, kleine Eule!, includes six owls, and players can make their game more challenging by adding more owls to the track at the start of the game.
94483.name: Hoot Owl Hoot!

94484.name: Stone Soup
94484.description:
From the classic tale of cooperation comes this simple game where players work together to "cook" a soup by making matches of ingredients. Match all of the ingredients before the fire under the kettle goes out and everyone wins! Turn all cards face down on the board. Players take turns turning 2 cards face up. If they match, place the 2 cards in the kettle area of the board. If they do not match, turn them face down. If a player turns a Fire Out card face up, the Fire Out card is placed on the fire area. If 10 Fire Out cards are placed in the fire area before all 12 matches are made, players lose. But wait, there is 1 magic stone card that can turn any Fire Out card face down again on the board. Players decide together when to use the magic stone card to help keep the soup cooking!

Components:

1 game board
24 soup ingredient cards
1 magic stone card
10 fire out cards
A Tale of Stone Soup story

94485.description:
The object of the game is to find and bring home all of the lost puppies before night falls. Be careful, the road is blocked and night is falling! To start the game, mix all the cards and place them face down on the spaces and homes on the board. Players take turns turning over cards one at a time to find the puppies and open a path home. If a night card (card with a star on it) is turned up, place it on the space on the board with the corresponding number. If a flashlight light or take-a-peek card is turned up, take it off the board to be used at a later time. Flashlight cards remove night cards and open the path! Take-a-peek cards allow players to peek under a night card. Strategy is key to this game, but a little bit of luck never hurts! Includes 3 instruction versions for a variety of play levels.

Components:

1 game board
12 night cards
6 flashlight cards
4 take-a-peek cards
6 puppy cards
94485.name: Lost Puppies

94486.name: Mermaid Island
94486.description:
Watch out, Mermaids! The Sea Witch is on the move! The object of the game is to move all 3 mermaids from start to Mermaid Island before the Sea Witch gets there. Because Mermaid Island is a cooperative game players play any of the mermaid tokens - no one player has a single mermaid she is trying to get back to the island. Players take turns spinning the spinner and moving a mermaid or the Sea Witch. Mermaids move 1 or 2 spaces at a time and can take the bridge short cuts. The Sea Witch moves only 1 space at a time and always goes the long way around. If the Sea Witch lands on a mermaid, the mermaid must go back to start. But mermaids can collect wand tokens which move the Sea Witch back one space. Players decide together when to use the wands and which mermaids to move to keep the mermaids going. Looks deceptively simple, but is a lively and strategic game of chase!

Components:

1 game board
3 mermaid tokens
1 sea witch with stand
4 wand tokens
1 spinner

94487.name: This or That?
boardgameversion: Peaceable Kingdom Press Just for Girls Edition
94487.description:
This or That? is a get-to-know-you game, so be honest with your answers! Player 1 draws a stick from the box and reads the question out loud. He decides which of the two options is his favorite and keeps his answer a secret until all players have guessed. After all players guess Player 1’s answer, he tells them what his answer is. If playing with points, each player to guess Player 1’s answer gets a point. Now it is Player 2’s turn to draw a stick and for the other players to guess. See how well you know your friends!

Components:

80 sticks with 160 questions

94488.name: 4Up!
94488.description:
4Up! Silly Animals Card Game - deal 4 cards to each player and lay 4 cards out on the table. Take turns matching cards from your hand with cards on the table. Add math and you’ve got a challenge game perfect for kids 5 and up. Deal 4 cards to each player and lay 4 down. Match 1 card in your hand with 1 or more cards on the table that add up to the number of the card in your hand. For example, if you have a 9 in your hand you can pick up a 9 from the table or you can pick up a 7 and a 2 or a 5 and a 4 or any combination that adds up to the number of the card in your hand. The player with the most cards wins!

Components:

48 cards

94489.name: Crazy Mates Card Game
94489.description:
Crazy Eights with a pirate twist!
Deal the cards and match numbers and suits. The first player to get rid of all his cards first, wins! It’s simple, but it’s not easy! Lay down a Crazy Nate 8 and you can turn the game to your advantage.
Each player plays a card of the same number or suit as the top card in the discard pile. For example, if the top card is a 4 of Scurvy Sam, the player may discard any 4 or any Scurvy Sam. If the player does not have a 4 or a Scurvy Sam, he must pick one card from the draw pile, unless he has a Crazy Nate 8. A player may discard a Crazy Nate 8 and change the suit to any suit of his choosing. The first player to get rid of all of his cards and shout "Shiver me timbers" wins!
For a more challenging game you can add variations - for instance, when a 2 is played the next player must play 2 cards and if he can’t, he must draw 2 cards. Variations are listed in the instructions.

Components:

48 cards

94490.name: Slammin' Bananas Card Game
94490.description:
Object: To be the first player to get rid of all the cards in your 4 stock piles.
Stock Pile 1 - 1 card face up
Stock Pile 2 - 1 card face down and 1 card face up
Stock Pile 3 - 2 cards face down and 1 card face up
Stock Pile 4 - 3 cards face down and 1 card face up
Stack the rest of the cards face down at the far left of the row. This is the banana pile.

Together, players begin to take the top cards from their banana pile and place it face up in the center
between them. As quickly as possible and at the same time, and using only 1 hand, both players play cards in sequence up or down from their face
up stock piles onto either of the center cards. For example, if one of the center cards is a 4, either a 3 or a 5 can be played on it. Then a 4 or a 6 can be
played on the 5, and so on.
If a player’s banana pile runs out, he takes a center pile (leaving the top card in the center), shuffles it, turns it over to become his banana pile, and
continues playing.
Game End: The first player to play all of his stock pile cards wins.

Components:

52 cards

94493.name: Zaibatsu
94493.description:
The game is set in a cyberpunk future, players represent supercorporations rivals, the Zaibatsu, who struggle to obtain the domain and control of the global network of information, Cybernet and for this we serve a large number of agents, mercenaries pawns they use to achieve their targets.

Zaibatsu is a print and play cyberpunk-themed game, each player in game can move pawns, attack the pawns controlled by other players, put new hexagonal blocks to expand the modular board or gain control of the existing blocks to dominate the board and win the game

The game consists of cards, which allows variety of actions to choose, dice that add random and uncertainty to the game, and a modular board which adds replay value to the game, also each player have the opportunity to control simultaneously multiple pawns each one of them with special abilities and restrictions.

In the game will alternate turns until one player obtain a certain number of control counters over the board.

94494.name: Convers     Spiel-Stadt-Strategie
94494.description:
Goal: Become the mayor of a new city.

Rebuild ('convert') an old military area near Potsdam to a new town district with all infrastructure needed. Invest your money into different projects like area development, construction projects, parks ...

Start with a zoning map, but be active within common tasks, too; your different activities should be driven by yield and votes 'values'. Combined with the (luck) element 'die' it's just an 'in time investment', when evaluation takes place. You may build alliances, which can reduce the influence of luck.

How to play:
Everything is driven by the die; if you roll a:
1 - you possess parts of a park or get a zoning map
2 - everyone earns money (yield from all of your investments)
3 - draw and execute an 'action'card
4 - draw a 'chance'-card
5 - everyone earns money (yield from the housebuilding)
6 - everyone earns money (yield from commercial buildings)
The money you earn should be reinvested to increase your income

94495.name: Himmel über Aachen
94495.description:
User summary

Himmel über Aachen (The Sky above Aachen) is a campaign for Die Chroniken der Engel. It has originally been published as a series of articles in Mephisto (19, 21, 24, 25, 26, 32). Himmel über Aachen contains about 40 pages of campaign background (Aachen, Germany in the year 2660), and the adventures itself on about 50 pages.

The adventure chapters are:

Danse Macabre - The angel characters are confronted with a deadly plague that seems to have its source in the city of Aachen.
Die Gefahren des Weges - The Dangers of the Road - The players take on the roles of human members of the Angelitic Church on their road from Colonia Aggripinensis to Aachen.
Wolken über Aachen - Clouds over Aachen - Again, the player characters are humans that now arrive in Aachen and have to uncover a conspiracy.
Regen über Aachen - Rain over Aachen - Several missions for human and angel characters are presented that draw them deeper into the story.
Sturm über Aachen - Storm over Aachen - In the final adventure, the characters try to break the Diadochi reign over Aachen, while the New Order tries to hold the city and the armies of the Lord of the Flies want to destroy it.

94497.name: Dizzy Dice:  Ludo / Race & Chase
94497.description: Dizzy Dice is a children's game. The board is double sided - one side is a ludo game with standard ludo rules, and the other side is a straightforward roll-and-move game which is a race around the board, the winner being the first to cross all the bridges. The thing that the game is most remembered for is its Dizzy Dice character used to roll the dice. This is a transparent red plastic cube with legs and pressing down on the top of its head causes two dice inside to bounce around. One dice is a standard 1-6 and the other has coloured spots.

94001.description:
﻿Moblox is a physics puzzle game featuring 120 exciting and brain teasing levels.

The purpose is to make the green blocks fall from the platforms, easy ?! Sure but, as you go along levels, new kinds of block will come to make your task harder !

Source: The Developer Website.

94002.description: Nitro Dice is a card game despite the name. The dice are used as the race cars with the speed recorded on the die so everyone can see the state of the racers with just a glance. The cards are used both as the track which is customizable to the players taste and as a means to maneuver by matching the track sections you travel over with the same types from your hand. Some track cards have hazards on them allowing you to put obstacles in your opponent’s way forcing them to expend cards or take damage. Racers also have Nitrous Oxide tanks for an added boost for passing or just staying ahead of the pack.

94005.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tall Ships 8: The H.M.S. Victory is the greatest of our Tall Ships yet. "The H.M.S. Victory" gives you a historically accurate view the top deck of the famous British Ship of the Line. Perfect for bording actions, fending off sea beasts, or any other skirmish action. The total finished ship size is a monsterous 24 inches by 50 inches.

This set comes as a pdf product that is designed so you get the most for your money when you print them. Designed to be easily printed on any home computer, print only the sections you need for game play. (See the instructions page provided.)
