94173.name: Buzz!: The Music Quiz
94173.description:
Think you know your Guns N' Roses from your Stone Roses? Then grab a Buzz!™ Buzzer and get ready to humiliate those who don’t!

Featuring a kitsch retro-styled studio, 1000 music clips, 5000 questions spanning 6 decades of hits and 10 crazy rounds PLUS a perma tanned host so orange he almost glows in the dark, this is guaranteed to transform anyone’s living room.

6 dynamic round types test contestants’ music knowledge whilst giving them the opportunity to pass off tricky questions onto opponents, pillage other players' points and punish the ignorant.

The original instalment in the Buzz!™ series.

Up to 4 players

Over 5000 questions

Source: The Game Website.

94174.name: Buzz!: The Schools Quiz
94174.description:
The classroom hits the TV studio as kids get the chance to show off what they know!

Get quizzed on all the core school subjects for Key Stage 2 Geography, Maths, History, Science, English, Modern Foreign Languages and Religious Education.

The Schools Quiz may feature syllabus-correct National Curriculum content created by real-life teachers, but it’s a LOT more fun than copying from the text-book!

Up 8 players

Over 5000 questions

Source: The Game Website.

94175.name: Buzz!: The Ultimate Music Quiz
94175.description:
Try your hand at some musical buzzing action on PS3.

Test yourself among friends and family as you answer thousands of questions in this extensive quiz.

See Buzz with a new makeover as he puts your musical knowledge to the test.

Use the PlayStation Move motion controller to answer questions or take on your opponents with Buzz! Buzzers..

Source: The Game Website.

94176.name: Buzz!: Quiz World
videogamehonor: 2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee
94176.description:
Get your fingers on the buzzer because our lovable host Buzz is back in his most exciting quiz game yet – and this time the contestants take centre stage!

Create and customise the quiz you want to play

Buzz now uses names and nicknames to address each player

New characters, new rounds and over 5000 new questions

Download extra quiz packs on any subject you like

Create and share FREE quizzes with the MyBuzz!™ community

Team up for online “sofa vs sofa” quizzes!

Source: The Game Website.

94177.name: Scroungin' ASL News
boardgameexpansion: Kampfgruppe Peiper I: ASL Historical Module 2
94177.description:
a 6 page magazine that is a reissue of some of the top articles and scenarios from ASL News. 11 of the 12 scenarios are European, both Eastern and Western fronts, spanning from 1940 to 1945, the 12 scenario is set in Burma, 1942.

Above the Prayers is a 4 scenario campaign game set in Belgium and is based on Kampfgruppe Peiper.

Close to the Edge uses the Red Barricades map.

Scenarios:

Above the Prayers - a 4 scenario campaign game set in Belgium and is based on Kampfgruppe Peiper.
Close to the Edge - Uses the Red Barricades map.
Just Another Bridge - End of the war street fighting in Berlin. Pits a Tiger II and a Panther against several T34/85s, SU-152s and IS-2s.
State Farm 41
Freedom Fighters
Plans Gone Astray
A Bush Across the Street
Not to Lose Face
Death and Ruins
Sauve Qui Peut
Time to Burn
Rolling Thunder - a large 6 map armored slugfest set during the German invasion of Belgium. May 1940.




Several of the Scenarios were later reprinted in Critical Hit's Retro Pack II.

94178.name: Buzz!: Quiz World Special Edition
94178.description:
Compatible with the PlayStation®Eye camera!

Buzz!™: Quiz World Special Edition includes:

• Buzz!™: Quiz World Special Edition on Blu-ray Disc, featuring:

• Two 500-question bonus quizzes…
National Geographic™ Prehistoric Quiz
Comedy Movies Quiz

• 4 Wireless Buzz!™ Buzzers

• USB receiver

• 8 AA batteries

SPECIAL EDITION BONUS CONTENT!
In addition to all the features of the amazing Buzz!™: Quiz World, this special edition includes:

Two extra quiz packs previously available only at PlayStation®Store:

Do you know your stegosaurus from your diplodocus? Find out in the National Geographic™ Prehistoric Quiz (usual price €7.99)

Test your knowledge of the funniest films ever made in the Comedy Movies Quiz (usual price €4.99)

Each pack contains 500 bonus brain-teasers plus exclusive images and video to boost your Buzz!™ experience

Enjoy the hilarity of PlayStation®Eye support, as Buzz takes snaps of you and your friends throughout the game, then shows every moment of triumph and tragedy on-screen. Get your best Buzz!™ face on for a quiz party you’ll never forget!

Source: The Game Website.

94179.name: Buzz!: Brain Bender
94179.description:
Get ready for an all-new kind of Buzz!™ experience – it’s time to boost your brainpower the fun way!

Join Buzz – the world’s greatest host – and stretch your mind in 16 brain-bending mini-games

Test your solo skills or engage in exciting Brain Battles for up to six players on just one PSP™

A pocket puzzler the whole family can enjoy – who’s brainy enough to collect a complete set of Boffin Awards?

Source: The Game Website.

94180.name: Buzz!: Master Quiz
94180.description:
Join game show supremo Buzz for the perfect portable quiz! With thousands of questions, brought to life with a huge range of pictures and videos, Buzz is waiting to test your knowledge on movies, music, sport, celebrities and much, much more…

Enjoy “Pass Around” and “Quiz Host” multiplayer modes with up to 6 friends – you only need one PSP to get the party buzzing!

Exciting single player mode – will you come out on top after 15 fun-filled quiz challenges?

Play Wireless “Fastest Finger” games with up to four PSPs via Game Sharing.

Source: The Game Website.

94181.name: Buzz!: The Pop Quiz
94181.description:
Nuts about the very latest in pop? Then check out Buzz!™: The Pop Quiz and get quizzed on all the biggest stars and their hits from the nineties to now.


New rounds including ‘Pop Picker’ and ‘Video Stars’ let you enjoy pop videos and music clips as you battle it out to find who’s brain is in pop-perfect shape.

All your favourite characters return alongside Buzz, the quiz-quip maestro himself, for the series’ most on-it and up to date edition. Poptacular!

Up 8 players

Over 5000 questions

Source: The Game Website.

94182.name: Buzz!: The Sports Quiz
94182.description:
Think you know your sports? Well, Buzz!™ gets super competitive for this sporting edition, featuring thousands of questions on everything from football to the Tour de France.

Everyone’s favourite Buzz!™ characters return but this time in full sporting regalia - Disco Stevie returns as a basketball player, Gina as a tennis player and Pelvis as a darts player. And with 16 characters in total there is an alter ego for everyone - even Mr. Cheese himself Buzz has a new sports outfit!

As if that wasn’t enough there’s even a Hall of Fame where top performances are commemorated - perfect for those who love to show off!

Up to 8 players

Over 5,500 questions - the largest Buzz!™ title to date!

Source: The Game Website.

94183.name: Buzz!: The Mega Quiz
94183.description:
New features include a beefed up 8 player mode, brand new rounds including mystery challenges and a huge range of photos and video clips.

Get ready to be quizzed on absolutely anything, with all-new questions on TV shows, movies, music, sport, science, the natural world and more!

Cheeky contestants even get the opportunity to lark about with opponents in ‘Pie Fight!’

Presented in classic prime-time style by Buzz, the host with the biggest bouffant in showbiz, and jam packed with everything from taxing brain teasers to quirky trivia, this is the ultimate game-show experience!

Up to 8 Players

Over 5000 Questions

Source: The Game Website.

94184.name: Mortal Kombat: Unchained
94184.description:
Mortal Kombat: Unchained is the title of the PlayStation Portable version of Mortal Kombat: Deception, developed by Just Games Interactive. The game was shipped on November 13, 2006 in North America, November 24, 2006 in Europe, and December 9, 2006 in Australia. The game includes all the characters from the GameCube version, and four more characters—Blaze, Frost, Jax and Kitana—from Mortal Kombat: Deadly Alliance that are exclusive to the PlayStation Portable system. The four characters, however, have one fatality and no hara-kiri in contrast to other characters. An Endurance mode is an exclusive new feature where players can compete against a constant wave of opponents. The system's Wireless Ad-hoc functionality can be used for multiplayer games. Characters who remain hidden in the other version appear unlocked in Unchained. The producer Shaun Himmerick commented that the staff wanted to show players characters that were difficult to obtain in Deception such as Liu Kang. Although Midway did not develop the game, they helped Just Games Interactives optimize their code and the Wi-Fi linking, as they wanted to keep the framerate very high.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mortal Kombat: Deception", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94185.description:
Created to commemorate the 20th anniversary of ASL Oktoberfest (ASLOK), a annual ASL tournament held in Middleburg Heights, Ohio every year.

The scenarios are very well done, and in color. The unit list is generic boxes with no artwork for the counters. The scenarios cover a wide variety of ground, the East and west fronts, Sicily, Africa and the Pacific and span from 1939 to 1944. For better or worse, many of the scenarios do feature German SS units.

In a departure from the typical 2 player scenarios, Scenario 7 - Slaughter at Shanderovka, has explicit victory conditions set up for 3 and 4 player games. Scenario 2, Bydgoszcz Coup, and German armed civilians trying to stage a coup, to take over a city to hand over to the invading German Wermacht.
94185.name: Oktoberfest

94186.name: 1 on 1
94186.description:
User Summary

A simple one-on-one half-court basketball game. You may select from 8 characters and play to 11 points. It is designed to look like a 3-D game, but is in fact 2-D, similar to many early Playstation games.
The graphics were anime style, and one could also choose from different minigames to play.

94187.name: Absorb
94187.description:
User Summary

An Xbox Live Indie game, Absorb is similar to Rock, Paper, Scissors with colors. Your character is a floating green orb that must absorb the other colors. The object of the game is to be the largest and last orb remaining.
Yellow absorbs Red, Blue absorbs Yellow, Green absorbs Blue and Red absorbs Green.

There is also music.

94189.name: Aceball
94189.description:
User Summary
A simple little Pong clone, Aceball plays pretty cleanly. The formula is mixed up by the addition of random pop-ups that delay or change direction of the ball. Some levels require scoring multiple goals, others only one. It also features a four player mode for parties.

94190.description:
The second and final issue of Backblast.

This 42 page issue had several articles and 8 scenarios. The scenarios are a diverse lot covering both the East & West fronts, and two are based on island war in the Pacific. Compared to more modern scenarios several of these are long (10+ turns). The time frame spanned by the scenarios is 1940-1945.

Awakening the Spring is a 4 board, 10 turn scenario set in Hungary, pitting Tigers and Panthers against heavy tanks. Scenario 10 was later reprinted in Out of the Attic.

BB9 - Wedge in the Ice
BB10 - Surrender or Die
BB11 - Kangaroo Hop
BB12 - The Awakening of Spring
BB13 - Triumph Atop
BB14 - Forth Bridge
BB15 - Up Number One Road
BB16 - Ambitious Plans
94190.name: Backblast #2

94191.name: Mirror
94191.description:
User Summary

Mirror is a puzzle game involving placing reflected dots. The screen is a simple fractal background with a line representing a mirror on it, and a shadowy node. Once you guess where the node would reflect to, you place your marker and the game tells you how close you got. There are 81 levels, each more difficult than the last. The later levels involve up to 9 mirrors, with 9 different markers to be placed. Overall, the game offers a quiet, peaceful puzzle to crack.

94192.name: Fishing Girl
94192.description:
User Summary

In Fishing Girl, you play a tiny pink girl, separated by an expanse of water from a tiny blue boy. Your only recourse is to fish. Fish are automatically sold and you can use your money to purchase upgraded rods, lures and hooks. Some fish can never be caught and others will eat the fish right off your hook. Eventually, you must try to reunite with the the boy.

94193.name: Timothy Bradstreet: Vampire
94193.description:
From the Cover:

What yer holdin' in yer sticky little fingers represents one of my most exquisite pleasures. If there's anything I love, it's drawing dark portraits of whatever I want, spilling my brain on a page. The only condition: "They're vampires." Ever since I saw Katheryn Bigelow's film Near Dark (one of only two or three in the theater... five times), I've wanted to illustrate the work from Vampire: The Masquerade and what you see before you. White Wolf Game Studio gave me the chance to do it. I don't know if I or they expected the tremendous response that we received from all of you who are hip to the alternative, sensual, modern primitive, tattooed, gypsy white-trash aspects of the images created here, but we're thankful you did respond. A lot of influences played a part in this work: sex (I love to do the erotic ones), love, pain, frustration, strength, and of course the CD Vulgar Display of Power writhing in the background.


Additional User Summary:

This book is a collection of artwork by Tim Bradstreet for Vampire: The Masquerade. It showcases ten full-page black-and-white portraits of different vampire characters that will be familiar to owners of other books. These are printed on individual card sheets, stored within a folded envelope that includes a biography of the artist.

94194.name: Wraith Recon
94194.description:
Publisher blurb:

An original new setting for RuneQuest II, Wraith Recon transports the players into new roles and terrible responsibilities.

The Kingdom of Dardarrick is beset on all fronts. To the east, open warfare with the Republic of Lorn has claimed tens of thousands of lives over the past decade and trenches now run parallel to the border, uprooting towns and villages in their wake. To the south, Lorn’s ally, the Kingdom of Torres constantly threatens overt military action, and has been implicated in many raids on nearby towns as the nation reaches a fever pitch of religious hatred. The wildlands to the west and north are home to goblinoids, ogres and giants, who must be constantly beaten back as they encroach on Dardarrick territory. And even within Dardarrick itself, evil lurks as the followers of the deposed theocrat Tomarsson plot their fanatical return to power.

Players take the role of the legendary Wraith Recon units, dedicated special forces trained and equipped to operate far from the rest of the army. Entrusted with the most dire missions, the Wraiths are capable of overcoming almost any obstacle. Armed with the latest in Dardarrick magicks, and kept informed by the mysterious Spellcom system, Wraith Recon units are tasked with assassinations, raids, reconnaissance, and hostage rescue missions, in the name of truth, liberty and justice.

94195.name: The Art of Vampire: The Masquerade
rpgseries: The Art of the World of Darkness
94195.description:
From the Back Cover:

From the Long Night

The Kindred: predators and monsters to the last. A race of biblically cursed parasites, these vampires hide among humanity, eking out a Damned existence under the eyes of God and the noses of mortals. Each night, the Kindred steal forth to take the sustenance they need for their continued survival - human blood.

...To the Final Nights

The Art of Vampire: The Masquerade compiles the most noteworthy illustrations from the critically acclaimed storytelling game. Spanning eight years and more than 60 books, the Vampire game features artwork by top industry illustrators and talented up-and-comers alike. From the early look of the game, back 800 years into the Dark Ages, and returning once again to the modern nights, this book is a beautiful chronicle of the evolution of the vampire.

The Art of Vampire: The Masquerade includes:


Early and hard-to-find work from the visual artists who defined the look, and the up-to-date illustration from the revised edition and beyond
Art by Tim Bradstreet, John Van Fleet, Bill Sienkiewicz, John Bolton, Vince Locke, Guy Davis, Kent Williams and a host of others
A fiction introduction by Sandman creator Neil Gaiman

94196.name: The Art of Werewolf: The Apocalypse
rpgseries: The Art of the World of Darkness
94196.description:
From the Back Cover:

Red in Tooth and Claw

Nine feet of killing power. The sleek lines of a predator. The fangs and claws of a monster. The ancient weapons of a millennia-old culture. The trappings of shamanism. The tools and weapons of the modern world. It's impossible to look on a Garou and see it for anything other than what it is - one of Gaia's warriors, a fusion of man and beast that's greater than either.

Lon Chaney They Ain't

The Garou of Werewolf: The Apocalypse redefined what werewolves could be like in a gaming context. Bigger, badder and sexier than ever before, they set readers' imaginations on fire. And now the best of the visually inspiring illustrations that put these werewolves on the map are available in a stand-alone art book, ready to be turned loose. Veterans will enjoy the look back; newcomers will never look at werewolves the same way again.

94197.name: Michael Wm. Kaluta: Mage
94197.description:
User Summary:

This book is a collection of artwork by Michael Kaluta for Mage: The Ascension. It showcases ten full-page black-and-white portraits of different mage characters that will be familiar to owners of other books. These are printed on individual card sheets, stored within a folded envelope that includes a biography of the artist.

94198.name: The Art of Mage: The Ascension
rpgseries: The Art of the World of Darkness
94198.description:
From the Back Cover:

Reality Overthrown!

Their heritage is magic, their quest truth. They lead humanity to the far horizon and beyond. They are mages, the inventors of sorcery, science and faith. For centuries, they have battled to define existence and lead humanity to an enlightened age. Now, in an age when technology is humanity's magic, the magicians of yesteryear's mystic Traditions fight for survival and the key to the cosmos itself - Ascension.

Choose Your Truth

The Art of Mage: The Ascension draws together key art and symbolism from across the fundamental game of magic and horror. Herein you'll see magic and myth from the Renaissance, all the way up to the modern day and beyond, as envisioned by heroic mages and super-scientists. Span the entire spectrum of enlightenment with this gorgeous visual sensation that delved into the past and future of magic.

The Art of Mage: The Ascension Includes:


Material spanning the beginnings of the game to its most recent incarnation
Art from Alex Sheikman, Lief Jones, Guy Davis, David Leri, Christopher Shy and more
A look into the themes and inspiration behind both Mage: The Ascension and Mage: The Sorcerers Crusade from developers Phil Brucato and Jess Heinig

94199.name: Second Course
94199.description:
Expansion of the game "Food Lover's Trivia"
additional game card packs! 600 new all-food questions in each course!

94200.name: Mystery Case Files: 13th Skull
94200.description:
Shortly after moving into a mansion in Louisiana, tragedy befalls Sara Lawson and her daughter after her husband, Marcus Lawson, mysteriously disappears. Sara contacts you, the Detective, to search for her husband and discover the secret of the 13th Skull.

Before Marcus was kidnapped, he became obsessed with the curse and the treasure after finding a map of the estate. His daughter Magnolia believes her father was kidnapped by the ghost of a vengeful pirate named Captain Crown, seeking to protect his lost fortune and stop those who try finding it. With the locals all talking about the curse of the 13th Skull and their belief that Crown lived and buried his treasure in the mansion, Sara despairs of finding her husband.

Mysterious strangers around the town and swamp share valuable information. The Detective must look for skulls, map pieces, cannons and other clues, both hidden-object and logic, in order to solve the mystery. The Collector's Edition includes extra plot twists.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mystery Case Files: 13th Skull", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

94201.name: Mind's Eye Theatre: Vampire by Gaslight
94201.description:
From the Back Cover:

An Age of Romance and Gothic Elegance

From decadent dinner parties to foggy cobblestone streets, the world of the 19th century is a place of superstition and mystery, where ancient legends mix with modern penny dreadfuls, and the most scientific minds explore the spirit realm. Here the Kindred, long since banished to mere folklore, find themselves newly crowned celebrities, expressions of forbidden passion to a cultured world poised on the brink of a great transition.

Witness the Vampire Reborn

Vampire by Gaslight is the latest historical setting for Mind's Eye Theatre, based on N/A. Presented here is all the material you need to play a vampire in this refined and distant era. The clans, their allies and enemies, a wealth of information about the mortal world at the height of the Victorian era... and how the Kindred claim it as their own.

94202.name: Team
94202.description:
subtitle: 'a game for parents and their children'

Goal: Be the first to reach the target with your 3 meeples

A roll-and-move game where players are trying to reach the end of the game with their tokens. Players may take shortcuts on marked areas by looking for partners to 'bridge' the distance; the more you cooperate the higher the chance to win, as those who don't cooperate to cross areas must complete the full-path of the game.

Team is 'Snakes and Ladders' without snakes, but you may use ladders only if you allow someone else to use this shortcut, too.

Cooperative version: Collect additional chips for every cooperative action you are involved in; use those chips as a multiplier for your winning points according final ranking.

94203.name: Würfeljoker
94203.description:
Goal: Score most by accomplishing given dice combinations.
Combinations e.g. are:
easy => just a '6'; '1' '2' and '3'; .... up to 'parade' '1' up to '6'(very difficult).

Game 1:
Roll three dice and accomplish step by step the given combinations. If you can't use a die's number you are not allowed to use this die further more during your turn.You may choose to take a higher risk for the most valuable combinations/scoring - but if you fail you are going to loose your whole turn; three jokers can be used/added as multipliers, but only by increasing your risk.

Game 2:
Flip the tiles you are using to build up dice combinations over and try to be the first to strike the numbers

94204.name: Slugs
94204.description:
User Summary

"Slugs" start falling from the sky, and you must defend yourself, lest the touch you and turn you into a slug, too! Fortunately, you are an odd little creature that can fire pellets from the top of your head. Tilt your device to cause your character to slide left or right. The angle of the device also affects the angle at which you fire your pellets. The pellets are limited, but you can pick them back up, if you can dodge the falling, jumping slugs to get to them.

Each time you finish off a slug, its eye pops out, which you can scoop up, in order to heal yourself. Sometimes, the eye is a different color, which indicates either a temporary power-up, a temporary debility, a permanent upgrade, or one other nasty effect: A purple eye that rolls along like any other, but any pellets it touches go away!

Game play is in stages, and the game increases in difficulty as you progress through the stages. The slugs get [much] bigger, such that hitting one splits it into two smaller ones. The ground itself becomes dangerous, fog rolls in, and every once in a while, you must protect your defenseless girlfriend. Where you have 10 points of health and can take a minor beating, she is frail, and becomes a slug the instant they touch her.

94205.name: All About Football
94205.description: Officially licensed by the National Football League, All About Football is a trivia game consisting of a deck of 50 cards with 5 questions per card, 1 question each from 5 different categories. Once a player correctly answers a question from the first category, they get that card and advance to the second category. After collecting 5 cards (one for each category), a player must answer a question from whatever category the opponent chooses in order to win. There are multiple decks available, each centering on a different team.

94206.name: The Face of Death
94206.description:
From the Back Cover:

Face Death
Walk beside the Reaper
Glimpse life after life
Flickering beyond the Shroud

Welcome to the theatre of one man's mortality
The tableau of his lonely journey -
You who have felt Night's cold razor
You whom Fear has touched inside

Dare you stare into Oblivion's mirror?
Dare you stare into the eyes of the Restless?
Dare you see
The Face of Death?


Additional User Summary:

This book combines illustrative art and poetic text to set the mood for the Wraith: The Oblivion RPG.

94207.name: SAT Game for Dummies
94207.description: SAT Game For Dummies is the trivia-style board game includes 500 questions which represent the 5 SAT categories. Each question is timed to train players to work at the SAT pace. Risks and rewards encourage players to answer opponents' questions and also help the other players. The winner is the first player to collect diplomas in all five SAT question categories and return to the START. Overall, an interesting and welcome twist to aid in preparing for the SAT.
